Modified version of the German WWII sniper rifle Mauser Karabiner 98k - another work of the Forester, known for his love for the restoration and modernization of old captured weapons of the WWII era. The original wooden stock has been slightly lightened; a handguard is installed on its front part, allowing the installation of an additional night sight. The rifle is equipped with an excellent sniper scope manufactured by March, Japan. According to the Forester, this rifle is more suitable for hunting intruders in the Red Forest than mutants.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] March Tactical with PN-23 nozzle

Model 700 rifles have been produced in the USA by Remington since 1962. It is possibly the most widely used bolt-action sniper and hunting rifle in the United States. It is the top product of Remington Arms. There are many variants of the rifle for different cartridges, however, the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge was chosen for ammunition for this model for firing at long and extra-long distances. The rifle is fitted with a McMillan A5 stock, 26" PGW Defense C14 fluted barrel and muzzle brake compensator, as well as a Badger Ordanance Embedded Front Rail for additional night sights.
